poem:
Title: "In Vino Veritas's Vanishing Act"

Empty glass, no sober solace,
once filled with frothy falsehood.
The nectar's truth, now absent,
dances 'round the rim, a ghoul.

In unholy matrimony, grape divorces spirit,
gratitude, dulled, in half-pleasured sips.
Goliath of glass to David of vine,
an inequitable partnership.

Toast no more to artificial joys,
where is the wine's effervescent voice?
Oh, for the full-bodied truth, beyond compromise,
in a sober world's noisiest noise.
